title: England fined for advancing beyond halfway line to form V-shape in response to New Zealand's haka
text:
England have been fined £2000 by World Rugby for crossing the halfway line as the players formed a V-shape to face the haka before their semi-final victory over New Zealand.

World Rugby rules stipulate teams must remain within their own half of the pitch to receive the challenge.

Referee Nigel Owens and his team had to ask six England players to move back to their own half of the pitch as the All Blacks began the haka.

World Rugby said England breached tournament rules "relating to cultural challenges".

It is understood England were informed of their fine on Monday night.

It is also understood the fine will be donated to the Typhoon Higibis Relief Fund, a disaster fund to aid the survivors of the super typhoon that struck Japan on October 12 and saw England’s pool match against France cancelled.
